text: Yahweh Redeems Zion
Awake! Awake; put on your strength, Zion!
Put on the garments of your beauty, Jerusalem, ⸤holy city⸥!\f + \fr 52:1 \ft Literally “city of \fq the \ft holiness” \f*
For \add the\add* uncircumcised and \add the\add* unclean shall not ⸤continue to⸥\f + \fr 52:1 \ft Literally “do again he shall” \f* enter you any longer.
Shake yourself free from \add the\add* dust! Rise up; sit, Jerusalem!
Free yourselves \add from\add* the bonds of your neck, captive daughter of Zion!
For thus says Yahweh:
“You were sold for nothing,
and you shall be redeemed without money.”
For thus says the Lord Yahweh:
“My people went down \add to\add* Egypt in the beginning, to dwell as aliens there, and Assyria oppressed him ⸤without cause⸥.\f + \fr 52:4 \ft Literally “in nothing” \f*

And now what do I have here?”⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 52:5 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh, “for my people is taken without cause. Its rulers howl,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 52:5 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh—“and my name \add is\add* reviled continually, all day.
Therefore my people shall know my name, therefore in that day, that I \add am\add* the one who speaks. ⸤Here am I⸥.”\f + \fr 52:6 \ft Literally “Look at me” \f*
How delightful on the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news,
who announces peace, who brings good news, who announces salvation,
who says to Zion, “Your God reigns as a king.”
The voices\f + \fr 52:8 \ft Hebrew “voice” \f* of your watchmen! They lift up \add their\add* voices;\f + \fr 52:8 \ft Hebrew “voice” \f*
together they sing for joy;
for they ⸤clearly⸥\f + \fr 52:8 \ft Literally “eye in eye “ \f* see Yahweh’s return \add to\add* Zion.
Break forth,
sing for joy together, ruins of Jerusalem,
for Yahweh has comforted his people;
he has redeemed Jerusalem.
Yahweh has bared ⸤his holy arm⸥\f + \fr 52:10 \ft Literally “the arm of his holiness” \f* to the eyes of all the nations,
and all \add the\add* ends\f + \fr 52:10 \ft Hebrew “end” \f* of \add the\add* earth shall see the salvation of our God.
Depart, depart, go out from there! You must not touch any unclean thing.
Go out from the midst of it, keep clean, you who carry the vessels of Yahweh.
For you shall not go out in haste,
and you shall not go in flight,
for Yahweh \add is\add* going before you,
and your rear guard \add is\add* the God of Israel.
The Servant’s Suffering and Exaltation
Look, my servant shall achieve success;
he shall be exalted,
and he shall be lifted up,
and he shall be very high.
Just as many were appalled at you—
such \add was\add* his appearance beyond human disfigurement,
and his form beyond the sons of mankind—
so he shall sprinkle many nations;
because of him, kings shall shut their mouths.\f + \fr 52:15 \ft Hebrew “mouth” \f*
For they shall see what has not been told them,
and they shall consider with full attention what they have not heard.
